p: Natural compounds from Chinese herbs, including polyphenols, phenolic acids, flavonoids, terpenes, and other herbal ingredients, can be used as QSIs [ 20]. Previously, we screened natural food materials for active QSI substances, and revealed that aqueous polyphenols from Rosa rugosa flower have anti-QS activities [ 23]. Here, 38 kinds of Chinese herbs were screened for natural compounds with QSI activity. Active substances were selected to verify their effects on AI-1 QS-related bacterial phenotypes, including violacein synthesis, migration, and biofilm formation. This work provides the theoretical foundation for the development of new antibacterial drugs.
